biography.value: Imprisoned inside a mist-filled chamber in the Tomb of Horrors, Siren serves as evidence of Acererakâ€™s heartless sense of humor. This mysterious fey creature yearns to be released, but an enchantment laid on her by the demilich prevents her from telling visitors how to accomplish that task. If anyone succeeds in freeing her, she vows to be a lifelong friend.

description.value:
Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Siren touches one creature she can see within 5 feet of her. The creature must succeed on a [[/save int 13 format=long]] or take [[/damage 3d6 + 3 type=psychic average=true]] damage and be &Reference[stunned]{stunned} until the start of Sirenâ€™s next turn.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Amphibious. Siren can breathe air and water.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. Sirenâ€™s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[cha]{Charisma} (spell save DC 13). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

1/day each: charm person, fog cloud, greater invisibility, polymorph (self only)

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Magic Resistance. Siren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You attempt to charm a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} you can see within range. It must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The &Reference[charmed]{charmed} creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by you.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of fog centered on a point within range. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

You or a creature you touch becomes &Reference[invisible]{invisible} until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[invisible]{invisible} as long as it is on the target's person.

Special Notes: self only.

This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw to avoid the effect. The spell has no effect on a shapechanger or a creature with 0 hit points.

The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any &Reference[beast]{beast} whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen &Reference[beast]{beast}. It retains its alignment and personality.

The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious}.

The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the &Reference[nat]{nature} of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech.

The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.
